awd_titl_txt: MRI:  Acquisition of an ultra-centrifuge by the Natural Sciences department at UVa-Wise
awd_abstract_narration:
An award is made to the University of Virginia's College at Wise to purchase a JXN-30 hybrid ultra/high-speed centrifuge from Beckman-Coulter.  This machine will offer a wide range of capabilities to a diverse department that houses multiple scientific disciplines.  This centrifuge facilitates and improves an existing strong research environment at a rural public liberal arts college that serves a population with few opportunities to participate in the scientific process.  It is an investment in a region where unemployment is increasing as the coal-based economy declines. Benefits to society include potentially transformative educational opportunities for the Appalachian region of far southwest Virginia, which are investments in the talented students choosing to pursue higher education at UVA-Wise. When we teach these students how to ask open-ended questions and then allow them to use high-end equipment and resources, we show them they have the potential to complete much larger and more transformative projects. 

UVa-Wise is a rural liberal arts college dedicated to providing outstanding research experiences to its students, and regularly has more than 10% of full time students involved in research projects with faculty. The three faculty included in this award specialize in Biology and Chemistry. This centrifuge will further expand the research capabilities of two researchers in molecular and cellular biology who address basic questions related to essential cellular processes such as DNA repair and RNA processing.  The chemistry faculty will use the equipment to aid in the production and testing of organometallic compounds that may become anti-cancer therapies.  More specifically, these scientists and their students will be able to 1 - perform ultra-centrifugation on-site for crucial polysome analysis experiments that help define basic RNA processing events in organelles; 2 - concentrate novel metallo-pharmaceuticals to be tested for anti-tumor or anti-microbial capabilities; 3 - process water samples for environmental eDNA and/or detect numerous pharmaceutical contaminants; and 4 - process large volumes of cells expressing recombinant proteins that can help elucidate the mechanisms of the DNA excision repair process.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RECTOR & VISITORS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF VIRGINIA

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: University of Virginia's College at Wise

por.por_cntn:
What are the major goals of the project?

The goal was to obtain a hybrid high-speed + ultra-centrifuge.

 

What was accomplished under these goals (you must provide information for at least one of the 4 categories below)? 

Major Activities:

Upon receiving MRI funds in October 2019, a Beckman-Coulter Avanti JXN30 centrifuge, five rotors, and three years of a service contract were purchased. The equipment was installed in late November 2019.

Specific Objectives:

The centrifuge was proposed to aid at least three investigators in the Department of Natural Sciences at the University of Virginia's College at Wise - A. Bruce Cahoon, Floyd Beckford, and S. Michael Shell. 

 From November 2021 to October 2022, 12 independent-study undergraduate students and three faculty benefitted from the Beckman-Coulter Avanti JXN-30 centrifuge. Two manuscripts were published, several organellar genomes have been completed and submitted to GenBank, and two other manuscripts are under review. Data contributing to several other on-going projects were collected. 

 

PI – A.B. Cahoon 

The Beckman-Coulter Avanti JXN30 is being used to progress two research initiatives in my lab that have involved 10 undergraduate researchers this past year. The first is an exploration of algal organellar genomes and RNA processing. The second initiative is the exploration of microbial biodiversity in Appalachia using environmental DNA metabarcoding. 

 

Co-PI – Floyd Beckford

Dr. Beckford left UVA-Wise for another opportunity.

 

Senior Personnel – S. Michael Shell

During the 2021-2022 fiscal year the Beckman-Coulter Avanti JXN30 centrifuge was used in a Laboratory Methods in Biology (BIO2015) class.  Also, in the Summer 2022, 2 undergraduate researchers and (2) Upward Bound used the centrifuge to clarify solutions of photoreactive organometallic complexes prepared to test the biological activity of these proto-pharmaceuticals in human cells.  Additionally, the students used the centrifuge to harvest human cell cultures for cryogenic storage.  

 

What opportunities for training and professional development has the project provided?

Three faculty and 12 undergraduates have used the centrifuge to advance their independent study projects, resulting in publications.

How have the results been disseminated to communities of interest?

Three manuscripts have been accepted for publication.

McCullough AB, Chen J, Valentine NP, Franklin TM, Cantrell AP, Darnell V, Qureshi Q, Hanson K, Shell SM Ashford DL (2022) Balancing the interplay between ligand ejection and therapeutic window light absorption in ruthenium polypyridyl complexes. Dalton Transactions 26: 10186-10197. https://doi.org/10.1039/D2DT01237E

Cahoon AB and VanGundy B (2022) Alveolates (dinoflagellates, ciliates and apicomplexans) and Rhizarians are the most common microbial eukarytoes in temperate Appalachian karst caves. Environmental Microbiology Reports. https://doi.org/10.1111/1758-2229.13060

Davids KS, Tucker MA, Smith WH, Cahoon AB (in press) The complete mitochondrial genome of Aneides aeneus (Green Salamander). eBio https://www.eaglehill.us/programs/journals/ebio/ebio.shtml

 

Six presentations were made:

Kayla B. Deel, Isabella J. Maggard, B. Hope Mitchell, Megan E. Roark, A. Bruce Cahoon (2022) Testing Various Collection Methods for Freshwater Microbial Environmental Metabarcoding. Association of Southeastern Biologists.  Little Rock, AR

Kendall S. Davids, Margie A. Tucker, Walter H. Smith, A. Bruce Cahoon (2022) The Complete Mitochondrial Genome of Aneides aeneus (Green Salamander).  Association of Southeastern Biologists.  Little Rock, AR

Cahoon AB. Alveolates (dinoflagellates, ciliates and apicomplexans) and Rhizarians are the most common microbial eukarytoes in temperate Appalachian karst caves. (2022) American Society of Microbiology, Kentucky-Tennessee Regional Meeting, Johnson City, TN.

Maggard IJ, Deel KB, Gao Y, Cahoon AB (2022) Soil Microbiomes of Healthy vs Blighted Cultivated Ginseng (Panax quinquefolius) Roots. American Society of Microbiology, Kentucky-Tennessee Regional Meeting, Johnson City, TN.

Deel KB, Maggard IJ, Brown TL, Cahoon AB (2022) Microbial Bioindicators of Nonpoint Source Sewage Contamination in Karst Springs. American Society of Microbiology, Kentucky-Tennessee Regional Meeting, Johnson City, TN.

Cahoon AB. DNA Hunting in Appalachian Caves: Searching for life in the depths of darkness

(2022) Invited Presentation. East Tennessee State University, Department of Biology.

 

Ten chloroplast and mitochondrial genomes were completed and submitted to GenBank.  Their completion has been/will be important for several on-going projects. 

 

What do you plan to do during the next reporting period to accomplish the goals?

This is the final report.  The department of Natural Sciences will continue to fund the maintenance contract for the foreseeable future and this equipment will continue to impact students and faculty at UVa Wise.

 What is the impact on the development of the principal discipline(s) of the project?

 The centrifuge enabled the completion of projects related to organellar gene expression, Appalachian biodiversity, environmental DNA metabarcoding, and protein structural characterization by the PI, senior personnel, and their undergraduate independent study students. 

 

 What is the impact on the development of human resources?

 Three faculty and 12 undergraduate students have used the Beckman-Coulter Avanti JXN30 to advance their independent study projects.

 

What is the impact on physical resources that form infrastructure?

The installation of this centrifuge provided the Department of Natural Sciences at the University of Virginia’s College at Wise with a replacement for its failing high-speed centrifuge.

 


Last Modified: 11/01/2022
Modified by: Aubrey B Cahoon
